subject: Re: [junit] Problem running single test of a test case
msgSnippet: Mike, Go ahead and log the bug against Eclipse, if you please, since Eclipse s mechanism for running single tests is involved (although I m not convinced they
messageBody:
Mike,

Go ahead and log the bug against Eclipse, if you please, since
Eclipse's mechanism for running single tests is involved (although I'm
not convinced they won't bounce it to us. :-)

That said, I wonder if part of the issue is that you're running a
JUnit 3 test class in JUnit 4. This is of course allowed and
encouraged, but if you're not using the JUnit 4 functionality, running
the test case in JUnit 3 might be a good temporary workaround for the
situation. Thanks,

David Saff

On 2/12/07, Mike McAfee <memcafee@...> wrote:
>
>
> I am using Eclipse 3.2.1 and JUnit 4.1. I would like to run a single test
> that exists in a test case. A co-worker of mine is using Eclipse 3.1.2 and
> is able to successfully do this. Eclipse 3.2.1 acts and displays results as
> though one test was run. However, console output reveals that all tests in
> the TestCase class are being run.
>
>
>
> I put together a simple test class and ran it the same way I have done with
> the large test package. I encounter the same results.
>
>
>
> Here is the test class that I have put together:
>
>
>
> package test;
>
>
>
> import junit.framework.TestCase;
>
>
>
> public class Test extends TestCase
>
> {
>
> public void testOne(){
>
> int a = 1, b =0;
>
>
>
> System.out.println("testOne:" + (a+b));
>
>
>
> assertEquals(1, a+b);
>
> }
>
>
>
> public void testTwo(){
>
> int a = 1, b =1;
>
>
>
> System.out.println("testTwo:" + (a+b));
>
>
>
> assertEquals(2, a+b);
>
>
>
> }
>
> }
>
>
>
> I have right-clicked on the testOne() method and selected Run As->JUnit
> Test. The JUnit view shows one run for testOne. However, the console
> output is:
>
>
>
> testOne:1
>
> testTwo:2
>
>
>
> Can anyone offer insight as to why this is occurring? Is this something an
> Eclipse bug that should be reported?
>
>
>
> Thank you,
>
> Mike
